articles.title: Macquarie Value Fund Q2 2025 Commentary
articles.content: For the second quarter, Macquarie Value Fund Institutional Class shares trailed its benchmark, the Russell 1000Â® Value Index. Read more here.

articles.title: Davis Global Fund 2025 Semi-Annual Review
articles.content: Davis Global Fund posted a strong return of +14.12% in the first six months of 2025, outperforming its MSCI ACWI (All Country World Index) benchmark. Read more here.

articles.title: Davis International Fund 2025 Semi-Annual Review
articles.content: Davis International Fund posted a strong return of +16.32% in the first six months of 2025, though this was below the performance of the MSCI ACWI (All Country World Index) ex US benchmark.

articles.title: ADX: Discount Narrows Further, Likely Limiting Outsized Gains Moving Forward
articles.content: ADX's performance outpaced S&P 500 in share price returns, but future upside due to discount contraction is likely to be limited. Read more on ADX here.

articles.title: Does Apple Risk Falling Behind on AI?
articles.content: Apple doesn't want to be left behind on AI as its competitors scale up their investments and poach talent, but its efforts to catch up might already be late. Executing its AI ambitions comes at a time when it reassesses its manufacturing operations in China.

articles.title: Berkshire Hathaway: Load Up While The Market Ignores
articles.content: Berkshire Hathaway is deploying its $344B cash pile into undervalued stocks like UnitedHealth, while trimming Apple and BAC. See why BRK.A stock is a buy.

articles.title: After Gaining $394 Billion in Market Cap in 3 Days, Is Apple Stock on Its Way to Joining Nvidia and Microsoft in the $4 Trillion Club?
articles.content: Apple is closing in on $3.5 trillion in market cap, but it could take time to reach $4 trillion.

articles.title: Meta spends more guarding Mark Zuckerberg than Apple, Nvidia, Microsoft, Amazon, and Alphabet do for their own CEOs—combined
articles.content: Zuckerberg is not exactly the most popular guy.

articles.title: Apple's 10% Stock Pop: Time to Invest in the Technology Giant Embracing America?
articles.content: The company is adding a new $100 billion investment in the United States.

articles.title: Meet the British billionaire who still works harder than anyone he knows
articles.content: British investment guru Jim Mellon is executive chairman of Agronomics which has £150m invested in ‘clean food’ start-ups and scaleups.
